titleStmt.title: The true narrative of the confession and execution of Francis Nicholson who was executed this present Wednesday, being the 27th of this instant October, 1680. And hang'd up in chains at Hownslow-Heath, for murthering of one John Dimbleby at Hampton-Court this being his own true confession both to the Ordinary of Newgate, and several other ministers and others who came to him whilst he continued in prison, and have hereunto subscribed their names to attest the truth of this relation.
titleStmt.author: Nicholson, Francis, d. 1680.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C..
